title: Why was silk important in ancient China? - Quora

response.answer_text: First. Because in ancient time，Chinese silk was much greater than other country. With the trade of silk，Chinese government can get a lot of money. That’s also one of the reason why china、tea and other typical things is important in ancient china. Second. For Chinese, silk has many types, and the great type can represent the owner’s social position and good taste. That’s also like tea and china. In china， there are“four famous embroidery”, represent For cities embroidery technology. these cities’s embroideries are excellent，that silk there was expensive and only the rich can enjoy. Some silk also has other meaning. Silk in yellow can only be used by the emperor For example. So，Because it’s expensive and great，it’s important.

Silk has a long history in China, beginning with it being a material reserved for the Emperors and his family, a sign of royalty, wealth, and luxury. Eventually, as the culture changed, silk became a staple of China’s trade and economy, as no other country discovered how to make it independently, which was key in their success with exporting it. Due to how expensive it was, it became seen as a status symbol outside of China as well. China still today produces 78% of the world’s silk. If you’d like to know more about the history of silk in China, Silk-Road has a detailed timeline: Silk history - Silk-Road.com It’s also featured on many China Travel websites, such as Development, Significance, Travelers. You could also check with your local library for some books on the subject. I found The Silk Roads: A New History of the World by Peter Frankopan and The Silk Road: A New History by Valerie Hansen. Both look informative and are relatively new.
